Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: An open class is scheduled at the school, and the step-parent should attend
Situation2: Both have several free evenings this week and can choose any for a date.
Story: I stared at the calendar on my phone, my thumb hovering over the dates. My partner and I had finally found a week where both of us had a few free evenings—something that hadn’t happened in months. She’d been hinting at how much she missed our quiet dinners, just the two of us, and I wanted to make it special. But then, a reminder popped up: my stepson’s open class at school was scheduled for Thursday evening. His mom couldn’t make it, and he’d already asked if I’d be there. I could hear his hopeful voice in my head, and I knew how much it meant to him that I showed up for these things. At the same time, I could picture my girlfriend’s face, lighting up at the thought of a night out together. Both roles pulled at me—one expecting me to be a reliable parent, the other wanting me to be a loving partner. My chest tightened as I realized that no matter what I chose, I’d be letting someone down. I sat there, torn, unable to decide which expectation I should meet.
